result.execSummary:
The defendant Torrian Q Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Obtain AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety with random screens.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge; and pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant. Restitution set at zero.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.
Upon successful completion of all terms and verification for payment of all costs the court may consider motion for expungement.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Torrian Q Clark in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction-straight time, with credit for 4 DAYS time served.  This sentence is STAYED and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
-Cooperate with the Department
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Obtain AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random screens
-Seek / Maintain full time employment
-Restitution set at zero

The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample pay surcharge over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 
Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
********************************
In addition to the terms of probation, the court orders defendant to:
- Complete 100 hours community service

Upon successful completion of all terms and verification for payment of all costs the court may consider motion for expungement.  kmw

OFF RECORD

Defense request for an adjourned sentencing date is granted,    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 34  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-29-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.    lfc

Defendant Torrian Q Clark in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Tyrone Martin St Junior for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw

Defendant Torrian Q Clark in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/1/14.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Defendant Torrian Q Clark in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Torrian Q Clark in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
